qas.question: When did post-punk arrive on the scene?

answers.text: in the wake of the punk movement of the 1970s

qas.question: What did post-punk artists use in their music?

answers.text: critical theory, cinema, performance art and modernist literature

qas.question: What began to spring up around the post-punk music?
How did post-punk take on rock and roll?
When was the original punk movement?
What is a name for a type of rock music that is extremely varied in sound?
What elements of punk rock did post-punk depart from?

answers.text: musical conventions and wider cultural affiliations

qas.question: What subject matter does post-punk commonly mesh its musical sensibilities with?
What developed along with the music developments of post-punk?
What type of music developed from rock music?
What music conventions did post-punk draw insperation from?

plausible_answers.text: electronic music, black dance styles and the avant-garde, as well as novel recording technology and production techniques

qas.question: How did Post-Punk take on Punk music?

plausible_answers.text: musical conventions and wider cultural affiliations

qas.question: What elements of punk rock did post-punk have in common?

plausible_answers.text: in the wake of the punk movement of the 1970s

qas.question: When did the popularity of post-punk end?
What did punk music have that wasn't included in post-punk music?
What type of rock music has no variation in sound?
What subject matter is avoided in post-punk music?

context: <a5_0><b9_0><b17_0>Post-punk<b17_0/><b9_0/><a5_0/> is a heterogeneous type of rock music that emerged <a0_0><b15_0>in the wake of the punk movement of the <a4_0>1970s<b15_0/><a4_0/><a0_0/>. Drawing inspiration from elements of <b11_0>punk rock<b11_0/> while departing from its <a6_0><b14_0>musical conventions and wider cultural affiliations<b14_0/><a6_0/>, post-punk music was marked by varied, experimentalist sensibilities and its "<a3_0><b13_0>conceptual assault<b13_0/><a3_0/>" on <b10_0>rock tradition<b10_0/>. Artists embraced <b12_0>electronic music, black dance styles and the avant-garde, as well as novel recording technology and production techniques<b12_0/>. The movement also saw the frequent intersection of music with <a7_0><b18_0>art and politics<b18_0/><a7_0/>, as artists liberally drew on sources such as <a1_0>critical theory, cinema, performance art and modernist literature<a1_0/>. Accompanying these musical developments were <a8_0>subcultures<a8_0/> that produced visual art, multimedia performances, <a2_0><b16_0>independent record labels and fanzines<b16_0/><a2_0/> in conjunction with the music.
